groups.name: Things You Find in a Desk

easy.notes: Easy category ideas: (1) Stripes: zebra and tiger are striped; pencil and tennis ball both have distinctive markings. (2) Start with R: simple initial letter. (3) Clip-on items: common items that can be clipped. (4) Desk items: common school desk objects. Near-miss temptation: 'Ruler' could fit both 'Starts with R' and 'Things in a Desk', but it is placed in the desk group to keep clear.

groups.name: Words with the Same Ending Sound
Things That Grow on a Farm

medium.notes: Medium category ideas: (1) Similar ending sounds help spotting connections, but avoid exact rhymes beyond a single sound (pony/bunny/cookie/zucchini). (2) Compound words: recognizable parts combined to form a common item. (3) Farm items: farm-related, but keep each item distinct. (4) Shapes and uses: classic geometric names paired with common objects. Near-miss: 'Sun' could be part of 'Sunflower' or 'Sunrise' concept, but only 'Sunflower' is used to keep the fit clear.

hard.notes: Hard category ideas: (1) Movement: items involve transport and motion; tricky because 'Seasaw' moves differently. (2) Opposites: simple pairs but ensure each item clearly belongs to one side. (3) Color-changing items: not all objects truly change color in common scenarios, to avoid ambiguity; use obvious examples. (4) Everyday with a twist: ordinary items that can be grouped by a less obvious trait (e.g., items that come in sets or are commonly carried). Near-miss temptation: 'Clock' might fit both Movement and Color Change in some views, but it is not included to maintain exclusivity.
